utterance.speaker: Bert
utterance.content: Thank you very much. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That is unbelievable. Good for Bert.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Damn, the MacArthur Genius Grant.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Couldn’t have happened to a nicer guy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Everything is stupid and I want to go home.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s Sheldon’s way of saying he’s proud of Bert, too.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey, it’s not even called the Genius Grant, it’s the MacArthur Fellowship. Just like it’s not Frankenstein, it’s Frankenstein’s Monster. Which brings us back to that hulking simpleton over there. And if anyone’s a genius, it’s me for the way I brought that full circle.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How much money did he win?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Over half a million dollars.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And he doesn’t have to use it for research, he can do whatever he wants with it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, good, maybe he can build a nicer bridge to live under.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Here he comes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Right. Be polite.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know how to behave.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Do you?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, congratulations Bert.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, good for you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s amazing.

utterance.speaker: Bert
utterance.content: Thanks. I was as surprised as anybody. When they called and told me I won, I didn’t believe them. And then they said, no, you really won. And then I said, cool.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Someone call George R. R. Martin, this guy knows how to finish a story.

utterance.speaker: Bert
utterance.content: I’ve gotten pretty good at telling it. Well, see ya.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Some genius. I zinged him with sarcasm, he didn’t even notice.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know, and it was the greatest sarcastic quip I’ve ever heard.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, aren’t you a peach.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Who leaves their bike in the hallway? You know, if I knew how to ride one, I’d steal it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ignore him, he’s just cranky because Bert from the geology lab won a big grant.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, I heard him interviewed on the radio. You know, when they told him he won, he didn’t believe it, but then he did believe it. It was so funny.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Who listens to the radio any more?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Bert is studying the way microbes in rocks can survive in extreme environmental conditions.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: They say it could be a potential indicator of life on other planets.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know what, I’ve met Bert. Isn’t he an indicator of life on other planets?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You used to make those jokes about me. Now everything is Bert, Bert, Bert.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You know, Sheldon, maybe if you take the time to actually read Bert’s research, you’d be less bitter about him winning.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You want me to read a geology paper?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Honestly, I just want you to be quiet but I’m all out of taffy.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You busy? There’s somebody out here who wants to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Who is it?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Say hello to everybody’s little friend, remote control Stephen Hawking.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Where did you get that?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I found him in an old box.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Why would you buy it?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I didn’t buy it. I made it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Last question. What is wrong with you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What’s the big deal?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howie, it’s in poor taste.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, it’s not. Check it out, he says fun stuff.

utterance.speaker: Remote-control Hawking
utterance.content: Hey good lookin’, want to go for a spin?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: His eyes also light up in the dark.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s always fun watching him read someone else’s work.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s like scrolling through the emojis on my phone.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeh, why? Eh, why? Oh, that’s why.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sounds like the night we had coitus.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I hope you’re happy making me read this. Bert’s work is remarkable, and I’m more upset than ever. This is worse than when I had to admit that Cedric the Entertainer’s actually entertaining.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, it’s foolish to be angry that Bert’s work has merit.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, well I am angry. And you telling me not to be angry makes me angry. And do you know how hearing myself say the word angry over and over makes me feel?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ooh, ooh, ooh, angry?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I, I knew the answer. I got excited.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, buddy, why don’t we go for a walk, so you can calm down.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s a good idea. I guess everyone’s having them now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, I’m trying to help you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine. You can walk ahead of me and scare off the pigeons.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You just wave your arms a little and they fly away, it’s not…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, Raj, I’m gonna show you something. Now, one of us thinks it’s offensive, the other thinks it’s hilarious and a great idea. But, I’m not going to tell you who likes it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: This is tough, but I’m going to say it’s the guy who shows me YouTube videos of people getting hit in the nuts.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re crazy. I’ve worked with Hawking. He’s got a great sense of humour, and I think he’d like it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Okay, call him and show him. I dare you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I have no problem calling him.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Fine, then do it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Fine, I will.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: While you’re bothering the world’s most famous scientist, be sure to show him how funny he looks getting stuck under our dishwasher.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What’s this button do?

utterance.speaker: Remote-control Hawking
utterance.content: Gentlemen, start your wheelchairs.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You laughed when that guy got hit in the nuts.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I laughed because the guy was Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I admire you, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really, why?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re happy with who you are. You don’t get jealous of other people. Instead of being weighed down by ambition, you just float along like a dead body in a river.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I couldn’t just take the compliment. I had to ask why. You know, I do understand what you’re feeling. My brother and sister’s accomplishments have always been held over my head.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How did you deal with it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I wet the bed until college, but I don’t think that’s a quality fix.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can’t believe I was surpassed by a geologist. I mean, rocks. He studies rocks. If rock is so great, how come paper beats it? Leonard, I’m having a primal urge to throw this rock.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Do it. Visualize it as your anger and, and toss it out of your life.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Perhaps I will. This rock encapsulates all my negative emotions. I will cast you far away. Feel free to take out a pigeon while you’re at it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Let it fly.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ow, ow, ow, ow, ow, ow, ow, ow…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I tried to let go of anger and threw a rock into my foot.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Then he got more angry and kicked the rock with his other foot.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, and what happened to you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, I laughed so hard, I burst a blood vessel in my nose. It’s fine.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You know, it’s one thing to be envious, but now you’re injuring yourself. It has to stop.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Although if you are gonna do it again, please let me know, so I can get it on video.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You know, Sheldon, instead of fixating on what Bert has, you should appreciate all of the good things in your life. You’ve got love, you’re in good health, you’ve got a roof over your head.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, but you’ve got all those things, and no one’s lining up to be you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Anybody else want to try? I’m gonna go make some more tea and question my life choices.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re up.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: This is getting old fast, Dolores, knock it off.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, do you really think calling me names is helpful?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I do, your life is fine you big baby.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Maybe you’re right.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If it helps, I’m questioning your life choices, too.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you, Penny. You know, I just need to keep reminding myself that Bert’s success is not my failure.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: There you go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And that men of his large stature are more susceptible to a wide array of life-threatening diseases.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: There you go.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m conducting a quick survey. Do you think this respectful and loving tribute to a great man is in poor taste?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Do you think this is in poor taste?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Does it spin around and do tricks?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Then yeah.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What do you think?

utterance.speaker: Barry
utterance.content: That is hiwawious. Give me the wemote contwol, I want to dwive him into the girls’ westwoom.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, we’re done. It’s offensive.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Top of the afternoon, gentlemen.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re in a good mood.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, it’s a new day. I have a new outlook. You know, I realized I don’t need to worry about other people. I just need to think more about myself.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, how will we ever get used to the new you?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I’m glad to see you moving forward.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Bert did quality research, and he deserves whatever accolades he receives.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What is going on? Did you upgrade his software last night?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I think he might be learning on his own.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Then the robot uprising has begun.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me, I need to pay Bert a proper congratulations.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: He doesn’t just look like C-3PO, now he walks like him.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Bert? I wanted to let you know that I read your research, and your award is well-deserved.

utterance.speaker: Bert
utterance.content: Thanks. I’ve been hearing that a lot. Ever since I won, people think I’m great.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, just this once, you can count me as people, too.

utterance.speaker: Bert
utterance.content: You know, as a MacArthur Grant winner, I’m allowed to nominate someone for next year.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Really? I didn’t know that.

utterance.speaker: Bert
utterance.content: So I was thinking, you know, engineers don’t get a lot of respect. Is your friend Howard working on anything cool?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, I’m not sure. You know, you’d have to ask him. Excuse me. Aah. Leonard, I hurt myself again.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Excuse me, I have to go take some pictures.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I can’t believe you head-butted a water fountain.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, I went to punch the water fountain, slipped in water in front of the water fountain, and hit my head on the water fountain.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I can’t imagine you being violent.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s not hard. Just picture the Three Stooges, and then take away two stooges.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m so disappointed in myself. Jealousy is completely illogical.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s a human emotion, Sheldon. Everyone gets jealous. I’m jealous of Leonard and Penny and Howard and Bernadette for being in such happy relationships.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What about me and Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’ve always been jealous of how much money Raj’s family has.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thank you for saying that. Next to buying things, that is the best part about having money.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Ever since I met Penny, I’ve been envious of her looks.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Aw, thank you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s why I was so happy when you cut your hair off.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You know what I mean. You were still hot, but more like a why’d that hot girl cut off all her hair, hot.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You liked my short hair, right?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah. I loved it. Love you, love the hair, would love to change the subject.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Seriously, none of you liked it?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I thought it was brave. Does that count as liking it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, how come nobody’s talking about Howard’s dopey haircut?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I think he looks cute.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And I think you’re cute.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I think you’re both cute.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I think I hate all of you nerds.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sorry I’m moving slowly.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t mind. If you pull a butterscotch out of your pocket, it would be like I’m walking with my grandma.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, no. A plaque? Nobody wants to see this.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, change plaque to mixed-race couple and you are my grandma.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can’t take this any more. Bert. Bert. Bert.

utterance.speaker: Bert
utterance.content: Come in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, let’s do this, Bert? We need to talk.

utterance.speaker: Bert
utterance.content: What happened to you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Rock, rock, water fountain. I am not proud of this, but I have been envious of your recent success.

utterance.speaker: Bert
utterance.content: Wow, I won the MacArthur Grant, everyone’s jealous of me. Once I get Lasik, I’ll be out of things to wish for.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I was hoping by admitting my weakness to you, I’d somehow be unburdened.

utterance.speaker: Bert
utterance.content: Is it working?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. Now that you know my weakness, I hate you more than ever.

utterance.speaker: Bert
utterance.content: Well, you know, we’re both pretty smart. I bet if we put our heads together, we could come up with a solution.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We, hang on, you’re my enemy. Now, the enemy of the enemy is my friend. And right now, I’m my own worst enemy. That makes you my friend. Okay, I’m good to go.

utterance.speaker: Bert
utterance.content: Great. Now that we’re friends, want to see if we can get tickets to a taping of Ellen?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know what? This isn’t gonna work.

utterance.speaker: Bert
utterance.content: Sheldon, wait. You know, you’ve got a lot to be happy about. You’re at the top of your field, you have a great girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, that’s right. I have Amy. In the past, you’ve professed feelings for her. Does it eat you up inside that I have her and you don’t?

utterance.speaker: Bert
utterance.content: It used to. But now that I’m rich and successful, I think I can do better.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I can’t believe you punched Bert.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I didn’t punch him. He turned around, and I gave him a Captain Kirk karate chop. I’m not even sure he knows I did it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, Sheldon, I’ve got someone here who might make you feel better.

utterance.speaker: Stephen Hawking (on skype)
utterance.content: Hello, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Professor Hawking.

utterance.speaker: Hawking
utterance.content: I understand you’re struggling with professional jealousy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thanks, Leonard, now he’s not gonna think I’m cool.

utterance.speaker: Hawking
utterance.content: Don’t worry, I know how you feel. I have never won a Nobel Prize.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, wow, that doesn’t seem fair.

utterance.speaker: Hawking
utterance.content: It’s fine. I’ve been on The Simpsons.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How do you deal with the success of your colleagues?

utterance.speaker: Hawking
utterance.content: I remind myself every scientific advancement is a victory. Also, I was on Star Trek.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, it was a good one. He played poker with Sir Isaac, you don’t care.

utterance.speaker: Hawking
utterance.content: Don’t waste your time on jealousy Sheldon, you’re too brilliant.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: How can you feel bad if Stephen Hawking says you’re brilliant?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can’t. Thank you, Professor Hawking. You are a gift to mankind. There should be statues of you everywhere. You know, the Lincoln Memorial has a big chair. We could swap you right in.

utterance.speaker: Hawking
utterance.content: I always thought a motorized toy of me would be cool.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What a wonderful idea, how does this man not have a Nobel?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Do not tell Wolowitz.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Way ahead of you.

utterance.speaker: Ellen
utterance.content: A new study came out, and it said that laughing makes your brain work better. And I know that’s true because laughing has made me the smartiest. Although, on the other hand, babies laugh a lot, and they’re dumb.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do people know about her? ‘Cause she’s delightful.
